ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned basic writing, reading, and listening skills. This course is grammar heavy and most of the assignments and tests are to assess your grammatical skills.

As a complete beginner, I really appreciate the profound German listening, reading, speaking, and writing skills that I have learned in class. Some aspects of the beauty of the German-speaking countries were also exhibited, further amplifying my desire to visit at least one of them.
I learned the basics of German in speech, writing, and listening comprehension.
I attained a solid beginner level of the language.
In just 3,5 months, I learned enough German to read simple texts and communicate on a basic level. However, progress is so rapid and vivid.
This class was a great introduction to German. We covered vocabulary, grammar, German culture, and pronunciation.
I came in knowing absolutely no German. Now I have a beginner's understanding of it. I know introductory vocabulary and can carry on a simple conversation in German.

I learned the basics of German. Introducing myself, having conversations with others about things they like and what they want to do with their lives. I can also order food at a restaurant and ask for directions. I would be able to get by if I were visiting Germany.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course feels so smooth that I did notice that I learned quite a few German words and grammar in just a short span of time. The classes are superb, and the projects are great avenues to practice the language. An improvement would be perhaps to have more structure or uniform format of the homework assignments and other tasks.
The class is good at making you learn through thorough experience and consistent practice. No weaknesses.

Strengths: This course was very engaging and allowed everyone to participate in the class. 
Weaknesses: Sometimes difficult to grasp concepts due to pace of class
The course is well-structured and all parts of language learning are covered. Though, I believe more attention could be devoted to reading and writing.

It was a very well structured course which allowed us to build on concepts. It could be improved by including more class engagement with the teacher rather than fellow students. Sometimes it felt unclear whether we were doing something correctly as we weren't sure as students.

I think this course could be improved by including more projects. I felt that whenever we had a project or presentation, it would force me to stretch my language skills. They were also engaging and creative compared to tests or other assignments.

Unless you are great at memorizing vocab on your own, there isn't a lot of focus on it in class. I don't know if I would change this though, because I like the focus on grammar in class; I thought it was helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you have the time and motivation to put in the work, I recommend this course as it will help you build strong skills.
YES! If you really want to learn German, this is the way to go (along with some internal motivation).
Yes, if they want to learn German.
Yes I would, this was a very fun course to take if you are looking for a language. The workload was heavier, but the material was fun to learn about.
Yes, especially to those who have aspirations to develop language skills necessary for future work and research.
Yes! It was a great introductory course which facilitated learning.
Absolutely. If anyone is interested in taking German, I would definitely recommend this course because it provides an excellent, manageable way to begin to learn the language.
Yes! It was a great introductory course (I felt it helped me get a good boost into the language) and I enjoyed it.
